name: Additive tachycardia risk with multiple HR-increasing drugs
actions: Monitor heart rate and symptoms (palpitations, chest pain, dizziness).
Assess for arrhythmia history and other sympathomimetics.
Consider dose reduction or alternative therapy if symptomatic.

rationale: Both drugs can increase heart rate.
Combined effects increase risk of symptomatic tachycardia.

explanation_template: {A_name} and {B_name} can both increase heart rate. Using them together may increase tachycardia risk, especially in patients with arrhythmia history or other stimulants.

references.citation: PD stacking: shared tachycardia domain implies additive HR elevation.
